Message.Title: Was Wayne one of "the incredibles"?
Message.Msg: Earlier today Elon (Wayne, et al) posted the following: "VN, the term jumbo coined for the 747, a plane I helped produce we were called the" incredibles" when you were in diapers" Does this mean Elon (Wayne) claims to have been working for Boeing in the late 60's? Is he really that old or is he saying he worked on the 747 years later and that then qualifies him to be one of "the incredibles"? From the Boeing website history: "During the late 1960s, some 50,000 Boeing people belonged to a group called "The Incredibles." These were the construction workers, mechanics, engineers, secretaries and administrators who made aviation history by building the 747 -- the largest civilian airplane in the world -- in less than 16 months."
Boeing is creating a new automated way to make the 777x Times are a changing at Boeing!

Message.Title: Why Is Obama still bowing to Saudi king?
Message.Msg: Once upon a time, an American president would never have bowed to a foreign leader. Once upon a time, a strongly worded rebuke of the president of the United States -- like this one -- from a so-called "ally" would have been considered unthinkable and unacceptable. Once upon a time, the U.S. military was solely an instrument of U.S. foreign policy, not a rent-an-army to fight other countries' religious wars. So, why is the tail wagging the dog?

Topic.Title: Was Wayne one of "the incredibles"?

Message.Msg: Wayne (i.e. elonmusk909 and a host of different IDs) has claimed all sorts of things and not one of them has been found to be true. To the contrary, virtually every claim he has ever made has been shown to be patently false. The guy is a chronic liar. He's claiming to have worked on the 747's original development program in the 1960s and that he's one of "The Incredibles", but given his well documented history of lying it's almost certainly false. Consider the following. - He once claimed to have worked on the 737 production line for five years and at anytime could tell us all, with great ease, which A/Ps are moving down the production line in Renton and which operator each A/P is destined for. I actually work for Boeing, in Renton, and called his bluff by asking him some very simple questions about the A/Ps moving down the production line and he couldn't back up his claims. Wayne is a chronic liar. - He once claimed to be a retired, former, high-ranking HR manager for a Top Ten aerospace company and claimed that all he had to do was report me to Boeing Ethics (apparently for attempting to correct his tsunami of misinformation and lies) and it'd be a "done deal" (i.e. I'd be terminated). It didn't happen. Wayne is a chronic liar. - He once claimed to have spoken to a Ms. Andrews at Boeing Ethics and she was looking for me. I asked him to give me her phone number or location (e.g. building, floor, column, etc) and told him that I'd be more than happy to talk to her. All I heard was crickets. Wayne is a chronic liar. - You may have missed it, but he's now claiming that you and I are the same person and as you're no doubt aware that assertion is false. And no, simply having worked on the 747 doesn't make one a member of "The Incredibles". There are many, many more lies I could site, but you get the idea. All you need to remember is this. Wayne is a chronic liar.

Topic.Title: dproach 777 humm that 777 was a real 100% designed in house Boeing plane, the 787 is a MD plane get it now !

Message.Msg: The 747-8 is the direct competitor of the A380 and has won in several competitions from airlines. The difference is that Boeing hasn't to spend as much money developing the 747-8 versus what Airbus had to spend developing the A380. Plus Boeing has a freighter version of the 747-8, where is Airbus A380 freighter? There were two Qantas A380s where the turbines disks in the Trent engines causing damage to the wings and there has been at least one oil fire. When the wings on those Qantas A380s were being inspected that is when they found the cracks inside the wings developing. Qatar delayed taking delivery until later in the production line past those defective parts inside the wings causing cracking to occur. It's doubtful that Virgin Atlantic will ever take delivery of the A380s they ordered and look forward to receiving their Boeing 787s. By the way you can a lot further by not calling people #$%$ because they have an opinion that you don't seem to agree with, kind of makes you look like a child!

Topic.Title: morisretired pointed out Airbus A380 had problems wow really, and your point is ? A380 has delived 108 planes more that BA has orders

Message.Msg: All your Airbus barking is wasted wind!!! the plane will take decades if ever to break even. Science Airbus revises A380 break-even point Now 420 aircraft, up from 270 By Lester Haines, 20th October 2006 Related stories Airbus parent company EADS has announced a new break-even point for its troubled A380 programme - 420 aircraft as opposed to the previous 270, the BBC reports. Current orders for the A380 stand at 159. The A380 roll-out has now been delayed three times due to "wiring problems" and the first example will not be delivered until October 2007. New Airbus big cheese Louis Gallois recently admitted "painful" job losses were likely as a result of the knock-backs, while Rolls-Royce earlier this month suspended A380 engine production while "waiting for more details about requirements from Airbus". Airbus has calculated that the whole sorry saga will cost it €2.8bn in profits over the next four years, added to the €2bn it announced back in June 2006. Airlines, meanwhile, have expressed growing frustration at the situation. Qantas, which won't take delivery of the first of 12 A380s it's ordered until August 2008, recently asked: "How are we going to mount the capacity in the short-term?" Emirates, the biggest customer to date with 43 on order, admitted it was "reviewing its options".

Message.Msg: There are only a handful of airports in the United States that can handle the wing span of the A380 while the proposed 777X has folding wing allowing it to land in a lot more airports in the United States.

Topic.Title: “Rape the gay away” pastor won’t serve time

Message.Msg: It is kind of amusing. I do get the "popularity" thumbs/ up/down vote effect. Hooz asks what Bible verse might apply to this abominable behavior of Girouex. I draw upon my understanding and knowledge of the Bible and home in on a verse that says it simply and succinctly. A verse to which this Brent guy should have paid more attention. Unfortunately, many some how look at this life as a sort of eternity of its own - though it seems it gets shorter and shorter as we get older. But, as children, life seemed to last "forever". We know different now that we are adults. When "justice" is not applied, in this case, we feel a sense of illness in our society. What should be done to this guy? The Bible, in the Old Testament, would have prescribed having him being stoned to death. There was a time when we executed kidnappers and rapists. But, now, we are much more enlightened. And, the lack of justice is exceedingly frustrating. In the end, if we fail to impose some sort of reasonable punishment, those that have faith and believe what the Bible says, that man is headed for a heap of trouble - unless he repents. If he does not harden his own heart. The Bible says, "Seek the Lord while He may be found." That is why I provided that verse. Our system of justice is flawed and, day after day, is getting more incompetent, but the Lord will execute perfect justice that lasts for eternity.

Topic.Title: Alaska Airlines

Message.Msg: Good news for JetBlue Airlines, they came in second place for being the most efficient airline in the United States. The good news is that this was accomplished through their wise purchase of Embraer E190s. The Airbus A320 that JetBlue utilize are so, so for fuel economy but can not beat the Boeing 737s that Alaska Airlines uses when it comes to fuel economy.

Topic.Title: School privatization is a hoax, “reformers” aim to destroy public schools

Message.Msg: Hoodz offers thoughts of a union paid shill. We need an education revolution to sweep aside old school union shill #$%$ like Diane Ravitch. "I'm going to be writing a lot about the book in future emails, but I want to start with the most important revelation: Diane Ravitch (the author of hoodz_weiner_duh_turd's union shill screed) has been getting paid A LOT of money by the unions in the form of speaker fees – Brill estimates $10,000 per appearance and $200,000 over the past year – which by itself isn't a problem EXCEPT that: a) she's never disclosed these large payments, which anyone listening to her should know about; and b) she's a total hypocrite for criticizing reformers like me for supposedly making a lot of money from our activities (when in truth I've never taken a SINGLE PENNY and have instead given countless thousands of dollars and hours), while doing precisely this herself."
